text: Such a terrific game! Super nostalgic! The music, the characters, the dialogue--with voice acting!--and the outrageous story blended with fun gameplay to make a PS1 action rpg masterpiece.

text: most people bought it/rented it for the FFVIII demo. I ended up liking BFM above FFVIII, personally. It's short, but funny and amusing and can be a bit challenging at times. Boss fights are nice, and the music in general is awesome.

author: genesisSOC

text:
We must stop Steamwood from blowing up and destroying Allucaneat Kingdom! We cannot let the Vambies (I think?) from awakening! We must hold them off in the boarded up old church until dawn! Darn that restaurant with the secret huge underground fire dungeon! I conquered the dancing sister in the final dungeon!

So many epic memories.

author: Sephiko

text: @VGKing If you wanted to slash your way through the game, play the game's spiritual sequel, Samurai Legend Musashi. You needed tactics to complete this game, especially learning when to sleep and how to sleep enough effectively. You can also just buy some items that helped wake you up, as well, I believe.

text: @VGKing That system was actually very important throughout the game. Obviously, if you were using it during battle, you're doing something wrong.

author: erede007

text:
This game. .

-sigh-

Nostalgia through and through. This game was amazing in every way. I loved the subtle humor and all the references to food (Allucaneet Palace? Brilliant) and the gameplay was brilliant. 

I think I'm going to replay this game this week. Thank you Supra.
author: Song Of Ourselves

text: It sounds a bit scratchy without 720p+ turned on. This is a game I'll need to replay soon since I've only played it once back in '99. It gives me a lot of nostalgia, especially hearing this particular track. I think it came with a demo of Final Fantasy VIII as well, which was quite exciting.
